text: I wrote my first book, Theophilus, about everything Jesus began doing and teaching
speaker: Narrator

text: until the day he was taken up, after he had given instructions through the Holy Spirit to the apostles he had chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text: After he had suffered, he presented himself alive to the apostles with many convincing proofs. He appeared to them over a period of forty days and told them things about the kingdom of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Once, when he was eating with them, he commanded them, “Do not depart from Jerusalem, but wait for what the Father promised, which you heard from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit not many days from now.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So when they were together with him, they asked, “Lord, is this the time when you are going to restore the kingdom to Israel?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “It is not for you to know the times or seasons that the Father has set by his own authority.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you, and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After he said these things, he was taken up while they were watching, and a cloud took him out of their sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were looking intently into the sky as he went away. Suddenly, two men in white clothes stood beside them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “Men of Galilee, why are you standing here looking up into the sky? This same Jesus, who has been taken up from you into heaven, will come back in the same way you have seen him go into heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mountain called the Mount of Olives, which is near Jerusalem, a Sabbath day’s journey away.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they entered the city, they went to the upstairs room where they were staying. Peter and John were there, also James and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus, Simon the Zealot, and Judas the son of James.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of them kept praying together with one mind, along with the women, with Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days, when the group there numbered about 120 people, Peter stood up among the brothers and said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Gentlemen, brothers, the Scripture had to be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit spoke long ago through the mouth of David about Judas, who became a guide for those who arrested Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judas was counted as one of us and was given a share in this ministry.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now this man acquired a field with what he was paid for his wicked act. When he fell headfirst, his middle burst open, and all his intestines spilled out.
speaker: Narrator

text: This became known to all the residents of Jerusalem, and so in their own language that field was called Akeldema, which means Field of Blood.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, it is written in the book of Psalms:
May his residence be deserted.
Let there be no one dwelling in it.
And,
let someone else take his position.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Therefore it is necessary that one of the men who accompanied us during the entire time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,
speaker: Narrator

text: beginning from his baptism by John until the day Jesus was taken up from us, become a witness with us of his resurrection.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They proposed two: Joseph called Barsabbas (who was also called Justus) and Matthias.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they prayed, “Lord, you know everyone’s heart. Show us which of these two you have chosen
speaker: Narrator

text: to take the place in this apostolic ministry from which Judas turned away to go to his own place.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they assigned lots for them, and the lot fell to Matthias. So he was counted with the eleven apostles.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the day of Pentecost came, they were all together in one place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly a sound like the rushing of a violent wind came from heaven, and it filled the whole house where they were sitting.
speaker: Narrator

text: They saw divided tongues that were like fire resting on each one of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in other languages, since the Spirit was giving them the ability to speak fluently.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there were godly Jewish men from every nation under heaven living in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: When this sound was heard, a crowd came together and was confused, because each one heard them speaking in his own language.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were completely baffled and said to each other, “Look, are not all these men who are speaking Galileans?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then how is it that each of us hears them speaking in his own native language?
speaker: Narrator

text: Parthians, Medes, and Elamites; residents of Mesopotamia, and of Judea, Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia,
speaker: Narrator

text: Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt, and the parts of Libya around Cyrene; visitors from Rome, both Jews and proselytes;
speaker: Narrator

text: Cretans and Arabs—we hear them declaring in our own languages the wonderful works of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They were all amazed and perplexed. They kept saying to one another, “What does this mean?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But others mocked them and said, “They are full of new wine.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter stood up with the Eleven, raised his voice, and spoke loudly and clearly to them: “Men of Judea, and all you residents of Jerusalem, understand this, and listen closely to my words.
speaker: Narrator

text: These men are not drunk, as you suppose, for it is only the third hour of the day.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the contrary, this is what was spoken by the prophet Joel:
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is what God says will happen in the last days:
I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh.
Your sons and your daughters will prophesy.
Your young men will see visions.
Your old men will dream dreams.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even on my servants, both men and women,
I will pour out my Spirit in those days,
and they will prophesy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will show wonders in the sky above,
and signs on the earth below,
blood and fire and a rising cloud of smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sun will be turned to darkness
and the moon to blood
before the coming of the great and glorious day of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And this will happen: Everyone who calls on the name of the Lord
    will be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Men of Israel, hear these words! Jesus the Nazarene was a man recommended to you by God with miracles, wonders, and signs that God did through him among you, as you yourselves know.
speaker: Narrator

text: This man, who was handed over by God’s set plan and foreknowledge, you killed by having lawless men nail him to a cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is the one God raised up by freeing him from the agony of death, because death was not able to hold him in its grip.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Indeed, David says concerning him:
I saw the Lord always before me.
Because he is at my right hand,
I will not be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore my heart was glad,
and my tongue rejoiced.
My flesh also will rest in hope,
speaker: Narrator

text:
because you will not abandon my life to the grave,
nor will you let your Holy One see decay.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have made known to me the paths of life.
You will fill me with joy in your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Gentlemen, brothers, I can speak confidently to you about the patriarch David, that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is with us to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since he was a prophet and knew that God had sworn to him with an oath that he would seat one of his descendants on his throne,
speaker: Narrator

text: he saw what was coming and spoke about the resurrection of Christ, saying that he was neither abandoned to the grave nor did his flesh see decay.
speaker: Narrator

text: “This Jesus is the one God has raised up. We are all witnesses of that.
speaker: Narrator

text: So, after he was exalted to the right hand of God and after he received the promised Holy Spirit from the Father, he poured out what you are now seeing and hearing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“For David did not ascend into heaven, and yet he says:
The Lord said to my Lord,
‘Sit at my right hand,
speaker: Narrator

text:
until I make your enemies
a footstool under your feet.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Therefore let all the house of Israel know for certain that God has made this Jesus, whom you crucified, both Lord and Christ.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the people heard this, they were cut to the heart and said to Peter and the other apostles, “Gentlemen, brothers, what should we do?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter answered them, “Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the promise is for you and for your children and for all who are far away, as many as the Lord our God will call.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He testified solemnly with many other words and was appealing to them, saying, “Save yourselves from this crooked generation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who accepted his message were baptized, and that day about three thousand people were added.
speaker: Narrator

text: They continued to hold firmly to the apostles’ teaching and to the fellowship, to the breaking of the bread, and to the prayers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Awe came over every soul, and many wonders and signs were being done through the apostles.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the believers were together and had everything in common.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were selling their possessions and property and were distributing the proceeds according to what anyone needed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Day after day, with one mind, they were devoted to meeting in the temple area, as they continued to break bread in their homes. They shared their food with glad and sincere hearts,
speaker: Narrator

text: as they continued praising God and being viewed favorably by all the people. Day after day the Lord added to their number those who were being saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter and John were going up to the temple at the ninth hour, an hour of prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: A certain man who was lame from birth was carried there every day and placed at the temple gate, which is called Beautiful, so that he could beg for donations from those entering the temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he saw Peter and John about to enter the temple, he asked them for a donation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter looked directly at him, as did John. Peter said, “Look at us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the man paid close attention to them, expecting to receive something from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter said, “Silver and gold I do not have, but what I have I will give you. In the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene, get up and walk!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter took him by the right hand and raised him up, and immediately the man’s feet and ankles were made strong.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jumping up, he stood and began to walk. He entered the temple courts with them, walking, jumping, and praising God.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the people saw him walking and praising God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They recognized him as the one who used to sit begging for money at the Beautiful Gate of the temple, and they were filled with wonder and amazement at what had happened to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: While the man held on to Peter and John, all the people came running toward them in utter amazement in the area called Solomon’s Colonnade.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter saw this, he addressed the people: “Men of Israel, why are you amazed at this? Why are you staring at us, as if by our own power or godliness we have made this man walk?
speaker: Narrator

text: The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, the God of our fathers, glorified his servant Jesus, whom you handed over and disowned in the presence of Pilate, though he had decided to release him.
speaker: Narrator

text: You disowned the Holy and Righteous One and asked to have a murderer given to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You killed the Author of Life, whom God raised from the dead. We are witnesses of this.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the basis of faith in his name, it is the name of Jesus that has strengthened this man, whom you see and know. This faith that comes through Jesus has given him this perfect health in the presence of all of you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now brothers, I know that you acted in ignorance, just like your leaders.
speaker: Narrator

text: But in this way God fulfilled what he had foretold through the mouth of all the prophets: that his Christ would suffer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore repent and return to have your sins wiped out,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that refreshing times may come from the presence of the Lord and that he may send Jesus, the Christ appointed for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: He must receive heaven until the times when everything will be restored, as God spoke through the mouth of his holy prophets long ago.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Moses said to the fathers:
The Lord your God will raise up for you a Prophet from your brothers who is like me. Listen to everything he tells you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is what will happen: Every person who does not listen to that Prophet will be completely cut off from the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Also, all the prophets from Samuel on, as many as have spoken, have talked about these days.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are the sons of the prophets and of the covenant that God made with our fathers when he said to Abraham:
In your seed all the families of the earth will be blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: “God raised up his Servant and sent him to you first, to bless you by turning every one of you away from your wicked ways.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As Peter and John were speaking to the people, the priests, the commander of the temple guard, and the Sadducees approached them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were very upset because Peter and John were teaching the people and proclaiming the resurrection from the dead in connection with Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: They arrested them and put them in jail until the next day because it was already evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: But many of those who had heard the message believed, and the number of the men increased to about five thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day, the rulers, the elders, and the experts in the law assembled in Jerusalem
speaker: Narrator

text: with Annas the high priest, Caiaphas, John, Alexander, and all the rest of the high priest’s family.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they made Peter and John stand in front of them, they began to question them: “By what power or by what name did you do this?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them, “Rulers of the people and elders of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: if we are being questioned today for a kind act that was done for the lame man, as to how this man has been healed,
speaker: Narrator

text: let it be known to all of you and to all the people of Israel that it was by the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene, whom you crucified, whom God raised from the dead! By him this man stands before you healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: This Jesus is the stone that was rejected by you builders, which has become the cornerstone.
speaker: Narrator

text: “There is salvation in no one else, for there is no other name under heaven given to people by which we must be saved.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they saw the boldness of Peter and John and found out that they were uneducated and untrained men, they were astonished and took note of the fact that these men had been with Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: But since they saw the man who had been healed standing there with them, they could not say anything in reply.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they had ordered them to leave the Sanhedrin, they discussed the matter among themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: They asked, “What should we do with these men? To be sure, it is evident to all who live in Jerusalem that a miraculous sign has been done through them, and we cannot deny it.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, in order that this may spread no further among the people, let us give them a strict warning not to speak any longer to anyone in this name.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they summoned them and commanded them not to speak or teach at all in the name of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter and John answered them, “Decide whether it is right in the sight of God to listen to you rather than to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we cannot stop speaking about what we have seen and heard.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After they had threatened them further, they let them go. They found no way to punish them because all of the people were praising God for what had happened.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the man on whom this miraculous sign of healing was performed was over forty years old.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Peter and John were released, they went to their own friends and reported everything the high priests and the elders had said.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard this, with one mind they raised their voices to God and said, “Master, you are the God who made the heaven, the earth, the sea, and everything in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By the Holy Spirit, through the mouth of our father David, your servant, you said:
Why do the nations rage
and the peoples plot in vain?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The kings of the earth take their stand,
and the rulers are gathered together
against the Lord
and against his Anointed One.
speaker: Narrator

text: “For certainly, in this city both Herod and Pontius Pilate, along with the Gentiles and people of Israel, were gathered together against your holy servant Jesus, whom you anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: They did whatever your hand and your plan had decided beforehand should happen.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now Lord, look at their threats and give to your servants the ability to keep on speaking your word with all boldness
speaker: Narrator

text: as you stretch out your hand to heal and as signs and wonders take place through the name of your holy servant Jesus.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After they prayed, the place where they were gathered was shaken. Also, everyone was filled with the Holy Spirit, and they continued to speak the word of God with boldness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The whole group of believers was one in heart and soul. No one claimed that any of his possessions was his own, but they held everything in common.
speaker: Narrator

text: The apostles continued to testify about the resurrection of the Lord Jesus Christ with great power, and abundant grace was on all of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was not a needy person among them. For from time to time those who were owners of lands or houses sold them, brought the proceeds received from what was sold,
speaker: Narrator

text: and laid it at the apostles’ feet. It was distributed to each one according to what anyone needed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph, who was called Barnabas by the apostles (which is translated “son of encouragement”), a Levite, a native of Cyprus,
speaker: Narrator

text: sold a field that belonged to him. He brought the money and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now a man named Ananias, together with his wife Sapphira, sold a piece of property.
speaker: Narrator

text: With his wife’s knowledge, he kept back part of the proceeds for himself. Then he brought a portion of it and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter said, “Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart to lie to the Holy Spirit and to keep back part of the proceeds of the land?
speaker: Narrator

text: Was it not yours before it was sold? And after it was sold, was not the money at your disposal? How could you plan such a thing in your heart? You have not lied to men but to God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Ananias heard these words, he fell down and died. Great fear gripped everyone who heard about it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The young men got up and wrapped up his body. Then they carried him out and buried him.
speaker: Narrator

text: About three hours later, his wife came in, not knowing what had happened.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Peter asked her, “Tell me, is this how much you got for the land?”
“Yes,” she said, “that was the price.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter said to her, “How could you two agree to test the Spirit of the Lord? Look! The feet of those who buried your husband are standing at the door, and they will carry you out too!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Instantly she fell down at his feet and died. When the young men came in, they found her dead. Then they carried her outside and buried her beside her husband.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great fear gripped the whole church and all who heard about these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many signs and wonders were done among the people through the hands of the apostles. With one mind, they all continued meeting in Solomon’s Colonnade.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one else dared to join them, but the people held them in high regard.
speaker: Narrator

text: More and more believers in the Lord were added to their group, large numbers of both men and women.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a result, people were even carrying the sick into the streets and laying them on cots and mats so that when Peter came by, at least his shadow might fall on some of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Crowds also gathered from the towns around Jerusalem, bringing the sick and those who were tormented by unclean spirits, and all of them were healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The high priest rose up, along with his associates (that is, the party of the Sadducees), because they were filled with envy.
speaker: Narrator

text: They arrested the apostles and put them in the public prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: But during the night an angel of the Lord opened the doors of the prison, brought them out, and said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Go, stand in the temple and keep on telling the people the whole message about this life.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
After they heard this, they entered the temple courts at daybreak and began to teach.
When the high priest and his associates arrived, they called together the Sanhedrin (that is, the whole council of elders of the people of Israel). Then they sent orders to the jail to have the apostles brought in.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the officers arrived, they did not find them in the prison. They returned and reported,
speaker: Narrator

text: “We found the prison securely locked and the guards standing at the doors, but when we opened them, we found no one inside!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the captain of the temple guard and the chief priests heard these words, they were puzzled about them, wondering what could have happened.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then someone came and reported to them, “Look! The men you put in prison are standing in the temple courts and teaching the people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the captain went with the officers and brought the apostles in without force, because they were afraid that the people might stone them.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they brought them in, they had them stand before the Sanhedrin. The high priest asked them,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Did we not give you strict orders not to teach in this name? Look, you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching, and you are determined to bring this man’s blood down on us!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter and the apostles replied, “We must obey God rather than men.
speaker: Narrator

text: The God of our fathers raised Jesus, whom you arrested and killed by hanging him on a cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: God exalted him to his right hand as Prince and Savior, to give repentance to Israel and the forgiveness of sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: We are witnesses of these things, and so is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard this, they were furious and began making a plan to put them to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: But a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law who was highly respected by all the people, stood up in the Sanhedrin and ordered that the men be put outside for a little while.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to them, “Men of Israel, consider carefully what you are about to do with these men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some time ago Theudas rose up, claiming to be somebody, and a number of men, about four hundred, joined him. He was killed, all his followers were scattered, and it all came to nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: “After him, Judas the Galilean rose up in the days of the census and led many people in a revolt. He also was killed, and all his followers were scattered.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So in the present case I tell you, keep away from these men and leave them alone! For if this plan or this undertaking is of human origin, it will fail.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if it is from God, you will not be able to stop them. Perhaps you might even be found to be fighting against God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: They were convinced by him. They summoned the apostles, beat them, ordered them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.
speaker: Narrator

text: The apostles left the Sanhedrin, rejoicing that they were considered worthy to suffer shame for the Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every day, in the temple courts and from house to house, they never stopped teaching and proclaiming the good news that Jesus is the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days, as the number of disciples was increasing, a complaint arose from the Greek-speaking Jews against the Hebrew-speaking Jews, because their widows were being overlooked in the daily distribution of food.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Twelve called together the whole group of disciples and said, “It is not right for us to neglect the word of God in order to wait on tables.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brothers, carefully select from among you seven men with good reputations, who are full of the Holy Spirit and wisdom. We will put them in charge of this service.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we will devote ourselves to prayer and the ministry of the word.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This proposal pleased the entire group. They chose Stephen, a man full of faith and the Holy Spirit, also Philip, Procorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicholas, a proselyte from Antioch.
speaker: Narrator

text: They had these men stand before the apostles, who prayed and laid their hands on them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word of God kept on spreading, and the number of disciples in Jerusalem increased greatly. Also a large group of priests became obedient to the faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Stephen, full of grace and power, was doing great wonders and miraculous signs among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some men who were from what is called the Synagogue of the Freedmen (Cyrenians, Alexandrians, and some from Cilicia and Asia) rose up and disputed with Stephen.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they were unable to stand up against the wisdom and the Spirit by whom he was speaking.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they secretly induced some men to say, “We heard Stephen speak blasphemous words against Moses and against God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They stirred up the people, the elders, and the experts in the law. They came, dragged Stephen away, and brought him before the Sanhedrin.
speaker: Narrator

text: They presented false witnesses who said, “This man never stops making threats against this holy place and the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: In fact, we have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place and will change the customs Moses handed down to us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: All those who were sitting in the Sanhedrin were looking intently at Stephen, and they saw that his face was like the face of an angel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the high priest asked, “Are these things true?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Stephen said, “Gentlemen, brothers and fathers, listen! The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham when he was in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Haran.
speaker: Narrator

text: God said to him, ‘Leave your land and your relatives and come to the land that I will show you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then he left the land of the Chaldeans and settled in Haran. After his father died, God had him move from there to this land where you are now living.
speaker: Narrator

text: “He gave him no inheritance in this land, not even enough to set his foot on. But God promised to give it as a possession to him and to his descendants after him, even though Abraham still had no child.
speaker: Narrator

text: God revealed that his descendants would live as strangers in a foreign country, and that they would be enslaved and mistreated for four hundred years.
speaker: Narrator

text: God added, ‘I will judge the nation that they will serve as slaves, and after that they will leave there and serve me in this place.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then he gave Abraham the covenant of circumcision. So Abraham became the father of Isaac and circumcised him on the eighth day. Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob became the father of the twelve patriarchs.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The patriarchs, filled with envy, sold Joseph into Egypt, but God was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: God rescued him from all his troubles and granted him favor and wisdom before Pharaoh, king of Egypt. And Pharaoh made him governor over Egypt and over his whole palace.
speaker: Narrator

text: “A famine came over all of Egypt and Canaan, causing great suffering, and our fathers found no food.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent our fathers on their first visit.
speaker: Narrator

text: On their second visit, Joseph made himself known to his brothers, and Joseph’s family became known to Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph sent word and invited his father Jacob and all his relatives to come to him, seventy-five people in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jacob went down to Egypt, and there he died, he and our fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their bodies were brought back to Shechem and laid in the tomb that Abraham had bought for a sum of silver from the sons of Hamor in Shechem.
speaker: Narrator

text: “As the time approached that God spoke about in the promise he had made to Abraham, the people increased and multiplied in Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: This continued until another king who knew nothing about Joseph became ruler of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: He took advantage of our people in a cunning way, and he mistreated our fathers by forcing them to get rid of their babies so that they would not survive.
speaker: Narrator

text: “At that time, Moses was born, and he was favored by God. For three months he was cared for in his father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: After he was placed outside, Pharaoh’s daughter took him in and brought him up as her own son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses was educated in all the wisdom of the Egyptians, and he was powerful in his words and actions.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But when he was forty years old, it entered his mind to visit his brothers, the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he saw one of them being mistreated, he defended him and avenged the oppressed man by striking down the Egyptian.
speaker: Narrator

text: He thought that his brothers would understand that God was giving them deliverance by his hand, but they did not understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day, he came across two of them while they were fighting, and he tried to reconcile them. He said, ‘Men, you are brothers. Why are you harming each other?’
speaker: Narrator

text: But the one who was harming his neighbor pushed him away, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and a judge over us?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you want to kill me the same way you killed the Egyptian yesterday?’
speaker: Narrator

text: At this remark, Moses fled and lived as an exile in the land of Midian, where he became the father of two sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: “After forty years had passed, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai, in the flames of a burning bush.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses saw it, he was amazed at the sight. As he went closer to look, the voice of the Lord said,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’ Moses trembled and did not dare to look.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to him, ‘Take your sandals off your feet, because the place where you are standing is holy ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have certainly seen the oppression of my people in Egypt, and I have heard their groaning. I have come down to rescue them. Now come, I will send you to Egypt.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “This is the same Moses they had rejected by saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and judge?’ This is the one whom God sent to be a ruler and deliverer with the help of the angel who appeared to him in the bush.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the one who led the people out, as he performed wonders and miraculous signs in Egypt, at the Red Sea, and in the wilderness for forty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the Moses who said to the people of Israel, ‘God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among your brothers.’
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the one who was in the assembly in the wilderness with the angel who spoke to him on Mount Sinai and with our fathers. He received living messages to give to us,
speaker: Narrator

text: but our fathers refused to obey him. Instead they pushed him away and turned back, in their hearts, to Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: They told Aaron, ‘Make gods for us who will go before us. As for this Moses who led us out of the land of Egypt—we do not know what has happened to him.’
speaker: Narrator

text: That was the time when they made a calf, offered a sacrifice to the idol, and were taking delight in the works of their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“But God turned away and gave them over to the worship of the heavenly bodies, as it is written in the book of the prophets:
Did you bring me slaughtered animals and sacrifices
forty years in the wilderness, house of Israel?
speaker: Narrator

text:
No, you even took up the tent of Moloch
and the star of your god Rephan,
the statues you made to worship.
Therefore I will send you into exile beyond Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Our fathers had the Tent of the Testimony in the wilderness. It was just like the model Moses had seen, just as he who spoke to Moses directed him to make it.
speaker: Narrator

text: After our fathers received it from him, they brought it in with Joshua when they took possession of the land from the nations God drove out before our fathers. It was here until the days of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: He found favor in the presence of God and asked that he might obtain a dwelling place for the God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it was Solomon who built a house for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “However, the Most High does not live in houses made by human hands, just as the prophet says:
speaker: Narrator

text:
Heaven is my throne,
and earth is my footstool.
What sort of house will you build for me? says the Lord,
or what is my resting place?
speaker: Narrator

text: Did not my hand make all these things?
speaker: Narrator

text: “You stiff-necked people, with uncircumcised hearts and ears! You always resist the Holy Spirit! You are doing just what your fathers did.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which of the prophets did your fathers not persecute? They killed those who prophesied the coming of the Righteous One, and now you have become his betrayers and murderers—
speaker: Narrator

text: you who received the law as transmitted by angels, but did not keep it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard these things, they were furious and gnashed their teeth at him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Stephen, full of the Holy Spirit, gazed up into heaven and saw the glory of God and Jesus standing at the right hand of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “Look, I see heaven opened, and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they screamed at the top of their voices, covered their ears, and rushed at him with one purpose in mind.
speaker: Narrator

text: They threw him out of the city and stoned him. The witnesses laid their cloaks at the feet of a young man named Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were stoning Stephen, he called out, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he fell to his knees and cried out in a loud voice, “Lord, do not hold this sin against them.” After he said this, he fell asleep.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Saul agreed with putting Stephen to death.
On that day a great persecution broke out against the church in Jerusalem, and all except the apostles were scattered throughout the countryside of Judea and Samaria.
speaker: Narrator

text: Godly men buried Stephen, and they mourned deeply for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Saul was trying to destroy the church by going into one house after another, dragging off both men and women, and putting them in prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: So those believers who were scattered went around proclaiming the gospel message.
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip went down to the city of Samaria and began preaching the Christ to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: With one mind, the crowds paid close attention to what was being said by Philip when they heard him and saw the miraculous signs he was doing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unclean spirits, crying out with a loud voice, came out of many who were possessed, and many who were paralyzed and lame were healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: So there was great joy in that city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was a man by the name of Simon, who had been practicing magic arts in the city. He amazed the people of Samaria while claiming that he was someone great.
speaker: Narrator

text: They all paid attention to him, from the least of them to the greatest, saying, “This man is the power of God that is called ‘Great.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: They paid attention to him, because he had amazed them for a long time with his magic arts.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they believed Philip, as he preached the good news about the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then even Simon himself believed. After he was baptized, he stayed close to Philip. As he observed the signs and great miracles that were taking place, he was amazed.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the apostles in Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent Peter and John to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter and John arrived, they prayed for them that they might receive the Holy Spirit,
speaker: Narrator

text: for he had not yet come upon any of them. They had simply been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter and John laid their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Simon saw that the Holy Spirit was given through the laying on of the apostles’ hands, he offered them money
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “Give me this power too, so that anyone on whom I lay my hands may receive the Holy Spirit.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter said to him, “May your silver perish with you, because you thought you could obtain the gift of God with money!
speaker: Narrator

text: You have no part or share in this matter, because your heart is not right in God’s sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: So repent of this wickedness of yours and pray to the Lord. Perhaps the intent of your heart may be forgiven you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I see that you are filled with bitter poison and chained by wickedness.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Simon answered, “Pray to the Lord for me so that nothing you have said may happen to me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After Peter and John had testified and spoken the word of the Lord, they returned to Jerusalem, preaching the gospel to many villages of the Samaritans.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now an angel of the Lord said to Philip, “Get up and go south to the road that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza.” (This is an isolated area.)
speaker: Narrator

text: So he got up and went. And there was a man, an Ethiopian eunuch, a court official of Candace, Queen of the Ethiopians, who was in charge of all her treasury. He had come to Jerusalem to worship.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was on his way home, sitting in his chariot and reading the prophet Isaiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Spirit told Philip, “Go over there and stay close to that chariot.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Philip ran up to it and heard him reading Isaiah the prophet.
Philip asked, “Do you understand what you are reading?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The man replied, “How can I unless someone explains it to me?” And he invited Philip to come up and sit with him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now the passage of Scripture the eunuch was reading was this:
He was led like a sheep to the slaughter,
and as a lamb before its shearer is silent,
so he does not open his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In his humiliation justice was denied him.
Who will talk about his generation?
For his life is taken from the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eunuch said to Philip, “I ask you, who is the prophet talking about—himself or someone else?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Philip began to speak. Starting with that very passage of Scripture, he told him the good news about Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were traveling along the road, they came to some water, and the eunuch said, “Look, here is water. What is there to prevent me from being baptized?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He ordered the chariot to stop. Then both Philip and the eunuch went down into the water, and Philip baptized him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they stepped up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord carried Philip away. The eunuch did not see him anymore, but went on his way rejoicing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip, however, found himself at Azotus. And as he went from place to place, he preached the gospel in all the towns until he came to Caesarea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meanwhile, Saul was still breathing out murderous threats against the disciples of the Lord. He went to the high priest
speaker: Narrator

text: and asked him for letters to the synagogues of Damascus, so that if he found any men or women belonging to the Way, he might bring them to Jerusalem as prisoners.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he went on his way and was approaching Damascus, suddenly a light from heaven flashed around him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to him, “Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He asked, “Who are you, Lord?”
He replied, “I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting.
speaker: Narrator

text: But get up and go into the city, and you will be told what you need to do.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The men traveling with him stood there speechless. They heard the voice but did not see anyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: They raised Saul up from the ground, but when he opened his eyes, he could not see anything. They took him by the hand and led him into Damascus.
speaker: Narrator

text: For three days he could not see, and he did not eat or drink.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There was a disciple in Damascus named Ananias. The Lord said to him in a vision, “Ananias!”
He answered, “Here I am, Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord told him, “Get up and go to the street called Straight, and at the house of Judas ask for a man from Tarsus named Saul. In fact, at this very moment he is praying.
speaker: Narrator

text: In a vision he has seen a man named Ananias come in and lay his hands on him so that he can regain his sight.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Ananias answered, “Lord, I have heard from many people about this man and how much harm he did to your saints in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he has authority here from the chief priests to arrest all who call on your name.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to him, “Go! This man is my chosen instrument to carry my name before the Gentiles and kings and the people of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, I will show him how much he must suffer for my name.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Ananias left and entered the house. Laying his hands on Saul, he said, “Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus, whom you saw on your way here, has sent me so that you may see again and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately something like scales fell from his eyes, and he could see again. He got up and was baptized.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And after taking some food, he regained his strength.
Saul stayed with the disciples in Damascus for several days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately he began to proclaim Jesus in the synagogues, saying, “He is the Son of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: All who heard him were amazed and said, “Isn’t this the one who raised havoc in Jerusalem among those who call on this name? Didn’t he come here for this very purpose: to bring them as prisoners to the chief priests?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Saul continued to get stronger and kept confounding the Jews who lived in Damascus by proving that Jesus is the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: After many days had passed, the Jews conspired to kill him,
speaker: Narrator

text: but Saul was informed of their plot. They were watching the gates both day and night in order to kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But his disciples took him at night and let him down through an opening in the wall by lowering him in a basket.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Saul came to Jerusalem, he tried to join the disciples, but they were all afraid of him because they did not believe that he was a disciple.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles. He described to them how Saul had seen the Lord on the road and that the Lord had spoken to him, and how in Damascus he had preached fearlessly in the name of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Saul stayed with them, coming and going freely in Jerusalem and speaking boldly in the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: He kept on talking and debating with the Greek-speaking Jews, but they were looking for a way to kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the brothers learned about this, they brought him down to Caesarea and sent him off to Tarsus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the church throughout Judea, Galilee, and Samaria enjoyed peace as it was strengthened. It grew in numbers as it lived in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: As Peter went around from place to place, he also went down to the saints who lived in Lydda.
speaker: Narrator

text: There he found a paralyzed man named Aeneas, who had been lying on a mat for eight years.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said to him, “Aeneas, Jesus Christ heals you. Get up and take care of your mat!” Immediately, he got up.
speaker: Narrator

text: All those who lived at Lydda and Sharon saw him, and they turned to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Joppa there was a disciple named Tabitha, which in Greek is Dorcas. She was always doing good deeds and acts of charity.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time she became sick and died. After they had washed her, they laid her in an upstairs room.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since Lydda is near Joppa, when the disciples heard that Peter was there, they sent two men to him, who urged him, “Come to us without delay!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter got up and went with them. When he arrived, they led him to the room upstairs. All the widows stood beside him, weeping and showing him the robes and clothing that Dorcas made while she was still with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Peter sent them all outside, he got down on his knees and prayed. Then he turned toward the body and said, “Tabitha, get up!” She opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter, she sat up.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave her his hand and helped her stand up. After he called the saints and the widows, he presented her to them alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: This became known all over Joppa, and many believed in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter stayed in Joppa for many days with a man named Simon the tanner.
speaker: Narrator

text: At Caesarea there was a man named Cornelius, who was a centurion in what was called the Italian Regiment.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was devout and God-fearing, as was his entire family. He gave generous gifts to the poor and always prayed to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: One day at about the ninth hour, he clearly saw a vision in which an angel of God came to him and said, “Cornelius!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Cornelius stared at him in terror and replied, “What is it, Lord?”
The angel told him, “Your prayers and your gifts to the poor have gone up as a memorial offering before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now send men to Joppa to get a man named Simon, who is called Peter.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is staying as a guest with Simon the tanner, whose house is by the sea.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the angel who spoke to him had left, Cornelius called two of his household servants and a devout soldier who was one of his personal attendants.
speaker: Narrator

text: After explaining everything to them, he sent them to Joppa.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day, as they were on their way and approaching the city, Peter went up on the roof to pray at about the sixth hour.
speaker: Narrator

text: He became hungry and wanted to eat, but while they were preparing the meal, he fell into a trance.
speaker: Narrator

text: He saw heaven opened and an object coming down. It was like a large sheet being let down to earth by its four corners.
speaker: Narrator

text: In it were all kinds of four-footed animals and reptiles of the earth and birds of the sky.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then a voice said to him, “Get up, Peter, kill and eat!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter said, “Certainly not, Lord, for I have never eaten anything impure or unclean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet the voice came to him a second time: “What God has made clean, you must not continue to call unclean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This happened three times, and then the object was immediately taken up to heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: While Peter was inwardly perplexed about what the vision he had seen might mean, just then the men who were sent by Cornelius arrived. They had asked for directions to Simon’s house and were standing at the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: They called out, asking if Simon, who was also called Peter, was staying there as a guest.
speaker: Narrator

text: While Peter was still deep in thought about the vision, the Spirit said to him, “See, three men are looking for you!
speaker: Narrator

text: Now get up, go downstairs, and don’t hesitate to go with them, because I have sent them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter went down to the men and said, “I am the one you are looking for. Why have you come?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They replied, “Cornelius the centurion is a righteous and God-fearing man, who is highly respected by the whole Jewish nation. He was directed by a holy angel to send for you to come to his house and to listen to what you have to say.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
So Peter invited them in and received them as guests.
The next day, Peter got ready and left with them, and some of the brothers from Joppa went along with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The following day, he arrived in Caesarea. Cornelius was expecting them and had called together his relatives and close friends.
speaker: Narrator

text: As Peter was about to enter the house, Cornelius met him, fell at his feet, and worshipped him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter helped him up and said, “Stand up! I too am just a man.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While he talked with him, Peter went inside and found many people gathered there.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “You understand how unlawful it is for a Jewish man to associate with or visit anyone who is not a Jew. But God showed me that I should no longer continue to call anyone impure or unclean.
speaker: Narrator

text: That is why I came without objection when you sent for me. May I ask why you sent for me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Cornelius replied, “From four days ago to this hour, I have been fasting. At the ninth hour, I was praying in my house when a man in shining clothes suddenly stood in front of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, ‘Cornelius, your prayer has been heard and your gifts to the poor have been remembered in God’s sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore send to Joppa and call for Simon, who is called Peter. He is staying as a guest in the house of Simon the tanner, by the sea. When he comes, he will speak to you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So I sent for you immediately, and it was good of you to come. Now then, we are all here in the presence of God to listen to everything that the Lord has instructed you to say.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter began to speak: “Now I really am beginning to understand that God does not show favoritism,
speaker: Narrator

text: but in every nation, anyone who fears him and does what is right is acceptable to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent his word to the people of Israel, proclaiming the good news of peace through Jesus Christ, who is Lord of all.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You know what happened throughout Judea, beginning in Galilee after the baptism that John preached.
speaker: Narrator

text: God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power. He went around doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the Devil, because God was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Indeed, we are witnesses of all the things he did in the country of the Jews and in Jerusalem, yet they killed him by hanging him on a cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God raised him on the third day and caused him to be seen,
speaker: Narrator

text: not by all the people, but by the witnesses God had already chosen—by us, who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: He commanded us to preach to the people and to testify solemnly that he is the one appointed by God as judge of the living and the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the prophets testify about him that, through his name, everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit came on all who were listening to the message.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the circumcised believers who had come with Peter were amazed that the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out, even on the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they heard them speaking in other languages and praising God.
Then Peter responded,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Certainly no one can refuse water for baptizing these people! They have received the Holy Spirit just as we have.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave directions that they be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they asked him to stay for a few days.
speaker: Narrator

text: The apostles and brothers throughout Judea heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter went up to Jerusalem, those who insisted on circumcision criticized him,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “You went to visit men who were uncircumcised and ate with them!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Peter began to explain everything to them, point by point. He said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “I was in the city of Joppa praying, and in a trance I saw a vision in which an object like a large sheet was let down from heaven by its four corners. It came right to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I inspected it very carefully, I saw four-footed animals of the earth, wild beasts, reptiles, and birds of the air.
speaker: Narrator

text: I also heard a voice telling me, ‘Get up, Peter! Kill and eat!’
speaker: Narrator

text: “But I replied, ‘Certainly not, Lord, for nothing impure or unclean has ever entered my mouth.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “A voice spoke from heaven a second time: ‘What God has made clean, you must not continue to call unclean.’
speaker: Narrator

text: This happened three times, and then everything was pulled up into heaven again.
speaker: Narrator

text: “At that very moment, three men who had been sent to me from Caesarea arrived at the house where we were.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Spirit told me to go with them without any hesitation. These six brothers also accompanied me, and we entered the man’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: He told us how he saw an angel standing in his house and saying, ‘Send to Joppa and call for Simon, the one called Peter.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will speak words to you by which you and all your household will be saved.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “As I began to speak, the Holy Spirit came down on them, just as he came down on us at the beginning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I remembered how the Lord had said, ‘John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So if God gave them the same gift as he gave us when we believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I to try to stand in God’s way?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard these things, they had no further objections, and they praised God, saying, “So then, God has granted repentance that results in life also to the Gentiles!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now those who had been scattered by the persecution that took place at the time of Stephen traveled as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus, and Antioch, speaking the word to no one except Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: But there were some men from Cyprus and Cyrene who came to Antioch and also began to speak to the Greeks, preaching the good news about the Lord Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord’s hand was with them, and a large number of people believed and turned to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: A report about this reached the ears of the church in Jerusalem, and they sent Barnabas to go on to Antioch.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he arrived and saw God’s grace, he was glad and encouraged them all to remain true to the Lord with devoted hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was a good man who was full of the Holy Spirit and faith, and a large number of people were added to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Barnabas went to Tarsus to look for Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he found him, he brought him to Antioch. So for a whole year they met with the church and taught a large number of people. It was in Antioch that the disciples were first called Christians.
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days some prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.
speaker: Narrator

text: One of them, named Agabus, stood up and indicated by the Spirit that there was going to be a severe famine all over the known world. This took place during the time of Claudius.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each of the disciples, according to his ability, decided to send relief to the brothers who lived in Judea.
speaker: Narrator

text: They did this, sending it to the elders by means of Barnabas and Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: At about that time, King Herod laid violent hands on some who belonged to the church, in order to mistreat them.
speaker: Narrator

text: He had James, the brother of John, put to death with the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he saw that this pleased the Jews, he proceeded to arrest Peter during the days of Unleavened Bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: After arresting Peter, Herod put him in prison and handed him over to four squads of four soldiers each to guard him. Herod intended to bring him before the people for trial after the Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Peter was kept in prison, but the church earnestly offered up prayer to God for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The very night before Herod was going to bring him out for trial, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers. He was bound with two chains, while sentries were in front of the door, guarding the prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly an angel of the Lord stood near him, and a light shone in the cell. The angel woke Peter up by striking him on the side, saying, “Quick, get up!” The chains fell from his wrists.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the angel said to him, “Get dressed and put on your sandals.” So he did so. Then the angel told him, “Put on your cloak and follow me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter went out, following the angel, but he did not realize that what the angel was doing was really happening. He thought he was seeing a vision.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had passed through the first and second guard posts, they came to the iron gate that leads into the city. It opened all by itself for them. They went outside, walked down one street, and immediately the angel left him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter came to himself, he said, “Now I know for sure that the Lord sent his angel and rescued me from the hand of Herod and from everything the Jewish people were expecting.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he realized this, he went to the house of Mary, the mother of John, who is also called Mark. Many had gathered there and were praying.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter knocked at the entrance gate, a servant girl named Rhoda came to answer.
speaker: Narrator

text: She recognized Peter’s voice and was so overjoyed, she did not open the gate. Instead she ran in and announced that Peter was standing in front of the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: They told her, “You are out of your mind!” But she kept on insisting it was so, and they started saying, “It’s his angel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Meanwhile, Peter kept on knocking. When they opened the door and saw him, they were astonished.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter motioned to them with his hand to be silent and described to them how the Lord had brought him out of prison. He said, “Tell these things to James and to the brothers.” Then he left and went on to another place.
speaker: Narrator

text: At daybreak, there was no small commotion among the soldiers about what had become of Peter.
speaker: Narrator

text:
After Herod searched for him and did not find him, he questioned the guards and ordered that they be executed.
Then Herod went down from Judea to Caesarea and stayed there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Herod was very angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon. They joined together and approached him after they had won over Blastus, the king’s personal assistant. They asked for peace because their country depended on the king’s country for food.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the appointed day Herod, dressed in his royal robes and seated on his throne, delivered a public address to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The crowd shouted, “It’s the voice of a god and not of a man!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately an angel of the Lord struck him down because he did not give the glory to God. He was eaten by worms and died.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the word of God continued to grow and increase.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Barnabas and Saul had completed their relief mission in Jerusalem, they returned and brought along John, who is called Mark.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in the church at Antioch there were some prophets and teachers: Barnabas; Simeon, who was called Niger; Lucius of Cyrene; Manaen, who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch; and Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were worshipping the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, “Set apart for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then, after they had fasted and prayed and laid their hands on them, they sent them off.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they were sent out by the Holy Spirit and went down to Seleucia. From there they sailed to Cyprus.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they arrived at Salamis, they proclaimed the word of God in the Jewish synagogues. They also had John as their assistant.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had traveled through the whole island as far as Paphos, they came across a sorcerer, a Jewish false prophet whose name was Bar-Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was with the proconsul, Sergius Paulus, who was an intelligent man. The proconsul summoned Barnabas and Saul and wanted to hear the word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Elymas the sorcerer (for that is what his name means) opposed them and tried to turn the proconsul away from the faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Saul, who is also called Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit and looking straight at him,
speaker: Narrator

text: said, “You are full of every kind of deceit and fraud, you son of the Devil, you enemy of all righteousness! Will you never stop twisting the straight paths of the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now look! The hand of the Lord is against you. You will be blind, and for a time you will be unable to see the sun.”
Immediately mist and darkness came over him, and he went around looking for someone to lead him by the hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the proconsul saw what happened, he believed. He was amazed at the teaching of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Paul and his companions set sail from Paphos and came to Perga in Pamphylia. John, however, left them and returned to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they went on from Perga and arrived at Antioch in Pisidia. They went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day and sat down.
speaker: Narrator

text: After the reading of the Law and the Prophets, the leaders of the synagogue sent a message to them, saying, “Gentlemen, brothers, if you have a word of encouragement for the people, say it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Paul stood up, motioned with his hand, and said, “Men of Israel and you who fear God, listen.
speaker: Narrator

text: The God of the people of Israel chose our fathers and made them a great people during their stay in the land of Egypt, and with his uplifted arm, he led them out of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put up with them for about forty years in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, and he gave their land to his people as an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: All this took about 450 years. After that, he gave them judges until the time of Samuel the prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then the people asked for a king, and God gave them Saul, son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for forty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: After removing him, he raised up David as their king. God testified about him: ‘I have found David the son of Jesse to be a man after my own heart. He will do all that I want him to do.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “From this man’s descendants God brought the Savior Jesus to Israel, in keeping with his promise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before he appeared publicly, John had preached a baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: As John was finishing his course, he said, ‘Who do you suppose I am? I am not that One. But look! That One is coming after me, and I am not worthy to untie the sandals on his feet.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Gentlemen, brothers, sons of Abraham’s family, and those among you who fear God, this message of salvation has been sent to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people of Jerusalem and their rulers did not recognize him, and by condemning him they fulfilled the statements of the prophets that are read every Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though they found no grounds for a death sentence, they asked Pilate to have him executed.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they carried out everything that was written about him, they took him down from the cross and laid him in a tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God raised him from the dead,
speaker: Narrator

text: and for many days he was seen by those who had come up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem. These same individuals are now his witnesses to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: “We are preaching to you the good news about the promise that was made to our fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God has fulfilled this promise for us, their children, by raising up Jesus. As it is also written in the second Psalm:
You are my Son.
Today I have begotten you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“That God would raise him from the dead never again to be subject to decay, God said in this way:
I will give you the holy and sure blessings promised to David.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Therefore he also says in another place:
You will not let your Holy One see decay.
speaker: Narrator

text: “For David, after he had served God’s purpose in his own generation, fell asleep, was laid to rest with his fathers, and saw decay.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the One God raised did not see decay.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So, gentlemen, brothers, let it be known to you that through this Jesus forgiveness of sins is being proclaimed to you, also forgiveness from everything from which you could not be justified through the law of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this Jesus, everyone who believes is justified.
speaker: Narrator

text: So watch out that what is said in the prophets does not happen to you:
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look, you scoffers,
be amazed and perish!
For I am going to do something in your days,
something you would never believe,
even if someone were to explain it to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As Paul and Barnabas were leaving, the people kept begging them to speak again on this same subject on the next Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the meeting of the synagogue had been dismissed, many of the Jews and devout converts to Judaism followed Paul and Barnabas, who talked with them and urged them to continue in the grace of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the next Sabbath almost the whole city gathered to hear the word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the Jews saw the crowds, they were filled with envy and began to contradict what Paul was saying by slandering him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Paul and Barnabas responded fearlessly, “It was necessary that God’s word be spoken to you first. But since you reject it and consider yourselves unworthy of eternal life, look: We are now turning to the Gentiles!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For this is what the Lord has instructed us:
I have made you a light for the Gentiles,
that you may bring salvation to the end of the earth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Gentiles heard this, they were rejoicing and praising the word of the Lord. All who had been appointed for eternal life believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord was being carried through the whole region.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Jews incited the God-fearing women of high standing and the leading men of the city. They stirred up persecution against Paul and Barnabas and expelled them from their district.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they shook the dust off their feet against them and went to Iconium.
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples continued to be filled with joy and the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: The same thing happened in Iconium. Paul and Barnabas entered the Jewish synagogue and spoke in such a way that a great number of both Jews and Greeks believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Jews who refused to believe stirred up the Gentiles and poisoned their minds against the brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Paul and Barnabas stayed there a long time, speaking boldly for the Lord, who confirmed the message of his grace by granting them the ability to perform miraculous signs and wonders.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the people of the city were divided. Some sided with the Jews and some with the apostles.
speaker: Narrator

text: When there was a plot by both Gentiles and Jews, together with their rulers, to mistreat and stone them,
speaker: Narrator

text: they found out about it and fled to the Lycaonian cities of Lystra and Derbe and to the surrounding countryside.
speaker: Narrator

text: There they kept on preaching the good news.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Lystra there was a man who was sitting down because he had no strength in his feet. He had never walked because he was lame from birth.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he was listening to Paul as he was speaking, Paul looked at him closely and saw that he had faith to be healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Paul said in a loud voice, “Stand up on your feet!” And the man jumped up and began to walk.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the crowds saw what Paul had done, they raised their voices, saying in the Lycaonian language, “The gods have come down to us in human form.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Barnabas they called Zeus, and Paul they called Hermes, because he was the main speaker.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest of Zeus, whose temple was just outside the city, brought bulls and garlands to the city gates, because he wanted to offer sacrifices along with the crowds.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the apostles Paul and Barnabas heard about this, they tore their clothes and rushed into the crowd, shouting,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Men, why are you doing these things? We too are men with the same nature as you. We are preaching the good news to you so that you turn from these worthless things to the living God, who made the heaven, the earth, the sea, and everything in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: In past generations he allowed all the nations to go their own ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet he did not leave himself without testimony of the good he does. He gives you rain from heaven and crops in their seasons. He fills you with food and fills your hearts with gladness.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Even though they said these things, they had a hard time stopping the crowds from sacrificing to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then some Jews came from Antioch and Iconium and persuaded the crowds to stone Paul. When they thought he was dead, they dragged him out of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: But after the disciples had gathered around him, he stood up and went into the city. The next day, he left with Barnabas for Derbe.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they preached the good news in that city and had gathered many disciples, they returned to Lystra, Iconium, and Antioch,
speaker: Narrator

text: strengthening the souls of the disciples and encouraging them to continue in the faith. They told them, “We must go through many troubles on our way to the kingdom of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They had elders elected for them in every church, and with prayer and fasting they entrusted them to the Lord, in whom they believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had passed through Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had spoken the Word in Perga, they went down to Attalia.
speaker: Narrator

text: From there they sailed back to Antioch, where they had been entrusted to the grace of God for the work they had just completed.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they arrived and called the church together, they reported everything God had done with them and how he had opened the door of faith for the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they stayed there a long time with the disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some men came down from Judea and began to teach the brothers: “Unless you are circumcised according to the law handed down by Moses, you cannot be saved.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Because this brought about a serious argument and debate between Paul and Barnabas and these men, they appointed Paul and Barnabas and some other men from the church to go up to Jerusalem, to see the apostles and the elders concerning this controversy.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they were sent on their way by the church, and as they passed through both Phoenicia and Samaria, they described in detail the conversion of the Gentiles and brought great joy to all the brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they arrived at Jerusalem, they were welcomed by the church, the apostles, and the elders, and they reported everything God had done through them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But some of the believers from the party of the Pharisees stood up and said, “It is necessary to circumcise the Gentiles and to command them to keep the Law of Moses.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The apostles and the elders gathered together to look into this matter.
speaker: Narrator

text: After there had been much discussion, Peter stood up and said to them, “Gentlemen, brothers, you know that some time ago God made a choice among you, that through my mouth the Gentiles would hear the message of the gospel and believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: God, who knows the heart, testified on their behalf by giving them the Holy Spirit, exactly as he gave him to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also showed that there is no distinction between us and them, cleansing their hearts by faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now then, why are you testing God by putting on the necks of the disciples a yoke, which neither our fathers nor we have been able to bear?
speaker: Narrator

text: On the contrary! We believe that we are saved in the same way they are—through the grace of our Lord Jesus.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The whole assembly fell silent and listened to Barnabas and Paul, who reported all the signs and wonders God had done among the Gentiles through them.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they finished speaking, James responded, “Gentlemen, brothers, listen to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon has reported how God for the first time has visited the Gentiles, to take from them a people for his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: The words of the prophets agree with this, as it is written:
speaker: Narrator

text:
After these things I will return
and rebuild David’s fallen tent.
I will rebuild its ruins,
and I will restore it,
speaker: Narrator

text:
so that the rest of mankind may seek the Lord—
even all the Gentiles who are called by my name,
says the Lord who does these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Long ago he made these things known.
speaker: Narrator

text: So it is my judgment that we should not cause extra difficulty for those among the Gentiles who are turning to God.
speaker: Narrator
